key_title: Key to the species of Aphanes

Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Rosaceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.; Jobson, P.C.
source.title: Rosaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Jeanes, J.A.; Jobson, P.C. (1996). Rosaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Calyx-lobes up to one-third the length of the hypanthium; hypanthium green to light brown at maturity; stipules usually not conspicuously veined
Calyx-lobes one-third to half the length of the hypanthium; hypanthium reddish-brown at maturity; stipules usually conspicuously veined
Hypanthium either glabrescent or hairs slightly spreading; calyx-lobes with spreading hairs, longer than those of the hypanthium
Hairs on hypanthium dense, silky white; calyx-lobes either glabrous or with hairs the same length as those of the hypanthium
